title: Absolutely Fabulous Greek Salad Dressing Recipe
description: This Greek salad dressing is easy to make with red wine vinegar, olive oil, and the perfect amount of seasonings to liven up salads, veggies, or any dish.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Sauces and Condiments Salad Dressing Recipes Absolutely Fabulous Greek Salad Dressing 4.7 (2,081) 1,533 Reviews 69 Photos This Greek salad dressing is the "secret recipe" from the pizzeria I work at. It's the best dressing I have ever tasted! People offer to buy it constantly, but if we sold it, we wouldn't be able to make enough for the restaurant! This recipe makes almost a gallon, but see the note below the recipe if you want to make a smaller amount. Submitted by DANIELLE M. Updated on February 3, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 69 69 69 69 Prep Time: 10 mins Total Time: 10 mins Servings: 120 Yield: 1 gallon Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This Greek salad dressing is bright, fresh, and flavorful. It's great for picnics and travels very well since it doesn't need to be refrigerated. It’s the perfect way to finish off all your favorite salads! What Is Greek Dressing?  Traditional Greek salad dressing is a Greek vinaigrette that contains olive oil, red wine vinegar, and seasonings (find the full list of seasonings below).  Recipe inspiration: 7 Traditional Greek Salads Beyond the Familiar DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  Greek Dressing Ingredients These are the simple ingredients you’ll need to make this Greek dressing recipe — you likely already have most of them at home:  Oil: Olive oil is the base of this Greek salad dressing recipe. Seasonings: This flavorful Greek dressing is seasoned with garlic powder, dried oregano, dried basil, black pepper, salt, and onion powder. Mustard: Dijon-style mustard lends complexity and depth of flavor. Red wine vinegar: Red wine vinegar adds brightness, cutting through the other flavors.  How to Make Greek Dressing Simply mix all the ingredients together. That’s it! You’ll find the full, step-by-step Greek salad dressing below.  How to Store Greek Dressing This Greek dressing can be stored at room temperature (in an airtight container) if you plan to use it within a day or two. If you’d like to keep it for up to a week, you should store it in the refrigerator. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise  “I’ve been using this dressing for years and it is excellent — perfect for those that enjoy a zesty, flavorful dressing,” raves one community member. “Delicious dressing, an absolute keeper,” says katya. “I've made this dressing many times now and received compliments on it. The only modification I make is to use the same amount of olive oil and red wine vinegar.” "This recipe really is absolutely fabulous!" according to one Allrecipes community member. "I use it on Greek salad and as a marinade for chicken. I make a batch every week so I always have it on hand." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 120 servings 1 ½ quarts olive oil ⅓ cup garlic powder ⅓ cup dried oregano ⅓ cup dried basil ¼ cup ground black pepper ¼ cup salt ¼ cup onion powder ¼ cup Dijon-style mustard 2 quarts red wine vinegar Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix olive oil, garlic powder, oregano, basil, pepper, salt, onion powder, and Dijon-style mustard together in a very large container. Pour in vinegar slowly while mixing vigorously until well blended. Store tightly covered at room temperature. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour over salad and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  To make 1 cup of dressing: Mix 6 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1 teaspoon dried basil, 3/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 3/4 teaspoon salt, 3/4 teaspoon onion powder, and 3/4 teaspoon Dijon-style mustard together in a bowl. Pour in 1/2 cup of red wine vinegar slowly while mixing until well blended. I Made It Print 3,301 home cooks made it! If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Absolutely Fabulous Greek Salad Dressing 01 of 69 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 69 Photo by  Donna Root Hollister Workman 06/21/2024 Easy to follow Great flavors A keeper! This salad dressing is amazing and you don't even have to refrigerate it! I'm glad that she did the math for us and that made it much easier. I tried to do the math myself and was not very successful! 03 of 69 Photo by  Brianna 02/07/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort After looking at the recipe I realized it was going to make WAY to much for my family. So I converted it down to 10 servings which is the perfect amount for a salad dressing Karaf that you buy at the store. These are the Measurements I used:* 1/2 cup Olive oil* 2/3 cup Red Wine Vinegar* 1.5 teaspoons Garlic Powder* 1.5 teaspoons Oregano* 1.5 teaspoons Dried Basil* 1 teaspoon Ground Black Pepper* 1 teaspoon Salt* 1 teaspoon Onion Powder* 1 teaspoon Dijon Style Mustard 04 of 69 Photo by  France C 12/04/2023 This makes a TON, so unless you are feeding an army, you will likely need to scale this down A LOT, like I did. This makes a really tasty dressing, not only for Greek salad, but as a marinade. I love tangy, acidic dressings, but I found the vinegar to be overpowering. There really should be more olive oil than vinegar to get a good balance, so I would adjust that next time. 05 of 69 Photo by  marilynrsood 08/24/2023 Yum!!Instead of going out to our favourite Greek/ Lebanese Restaurant to welcome home our daughter after her summer job out West, we decided to make dinner at homeThis recipe was great for our garden salad dressing!I followed this ratio of ingredients to make approximately 1 cup:-12 Tbsp olive oil- 8 Tbsp red wine vinegar- 2 tsp each of garlic powder, dried oregano, basil- 1.5 tsp each black pepper, salt, onion powder, Dijon mustardYummylicious! 06 of 69 Photo by  MelH 02/04/2021 Beautiful color and fragrant. I'll have it with chicken breast tonight after it has chilled in the fridge. *I used fresh garlic, pressed 07 of 69 Photo by  Meghann De La Cruz 06/09/2020 08 of 69 Photo by  amanda r 05/13/2020 This is a really great recipe! I scaled down to 8 servings, which was easy to shake up in a mason jar. Used honey Dijon, because it’s all I had. Really delicious, will definitely make again. 09 of 69 Photo by  H33th3r 03/16/2020 LOVE THIS! Thank you for sharing! I changed the servings to 5 so I could try this. I can taste all of the herbs while I’m eating my spinach, unlike another Greek dressing recipe I tried. This is going to be my go-to. 10 of 69 Photo by  Kim 03/12/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love The Best Lemon Vinaigrette 234 Ratings Orange Citrus Vinaigrette 53 Ratings Cucumber Tomato Salad with Zucchini and Black Olives in Lemon Balsamic Vinaigrette 64 Ratings Big Ray's Mediterranean Salad Dressing 2 Ratings Basil Vinaigrette 164 Ratings Vegan Dilly Ranch 2 Ratings Orange-Poppy Seed Dressing 3 Ratings Carrot Ginger Dressing and Dip 4 Ratings Pasta Salad with Homemade Dressing 276 Ratings Cucumber Salad with Dill Vinaigrette 35 Ratings Caper and Lime Vinaigrette 3 Ratings Keto Dressing 8 Ratings Tomato Tang Salad Dressing 19 Ratings Easy Shallot Vinaigrette 1 Rating Herb Garlic Oil 2 Ratings Creamy Tarragon Salad Dressing 12 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
